get_gfed4

Get data from the fourth-generation Global Fire Emissions Database (GFED4)

get_gfed4(start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL,
  temporal_resolution = "daily", varname = NULL, region = "GLOB")

Arguments

start_date

first date to download (string)
end_date

last date to download (string)
temporal_resolution

temporal resolution, it can be "daily" (default) or "monthly"
varname

name of the variable to extract. This can be one of the following:

  • "BasisRegions"

  • "BurnedArea"

  • "BurnedAreaUncertainty"

  • "MeanBurnDateUncertainty"

  • "source"

  • "TreeCoverDist"

  • "LandCoverDist"

  • "PeatFraction"
region

string of characters describing the region. It can only assume the 15 values listed below:

  • "Global"or GLOB

  • "Boreal North America"or BONA

  • "Temperate North America"or TENA

  • "Central America"or CEAM

  • "Northern Hemisphere South America"or NHSA

  • "Southern Hemisphere South America"or SHSA

  • "Europe"or EURO

  • "Middle East"or MIDE

  • "Northern Hemisphere Africa"or NHAF

  • "Southern Hemisphere Africa"or SHAF

  • "Boreal Asia"or BOAS

  • "Central Asia"or CEAS

  • "Southeast Asia"or SEAS

  • "Equatorial Asia"or EQAS

  • "Australia and New Zealand"or AUST

Value

A RasterBrick (if downloading observations) or spatial polygons (if downloading basis regions)

Note

The conversion from hdf5 to netcdf gets stuck in RStudio (see https://goo.gl/Rcvp9x), please use the console.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
  # Basis regions
  BasisRegions <- get_gfed4(varname = "BasisRegions")

  # Only BONA region
  BONA <- get_gfed4(varname = "BasisRegions", region = "BONA")

  # Monthly burned areas
  BurnedAreas <- get_gfed4(start_date = "2003-01-01",
                           end_date = "2003-01-31",
                           temporal_resolution = "monthly",
                           varname = "BurnedArea")

  # Daily burned areas
  DailyBurnedAreas <- get_gfed4(start_date = "2003-01-01",
                                end_date = "2003-01-02",
                                temporal_resolution = "daily",
                                varname = "BurnedArea")

# }
